Reviews.Content: Really nice place       Courtyard of the Courtyard
Reviews.Author: travellingtuba

Reviews.Content: Really great place!!! Got this hotel through a priceline bid. Was pleasantly surprised that its not just for business travelers! Great location far enough away from the French Quarter to avoid the crowds and noise at night, but close enough to walk down, enjoy it then go back to your nice hotel room.Over a two week trip this is the only hotel we stayed in where I used the gym and hot tub.Staff was helpful with directions and suggestions. Room was huge! There is no free breakfast, but you can buy theres for around $10. Skip it though, the day we went it was really crowded so the service suffered. NOT the fault of the staff, thats just the way it is. Besides, go out and eat with the locals and the Trolley Stop Cafe or the Coffee PotAlso after two weeks of hotels, this was the first one to have computers in the lobby with free internet access!Loved everything about this place!
Reviews.Author: arizona_8

Reviews.Content: Very nice stay in the Big Easy Our stay was a pleasant one. The hotel is within walking distance of the trolley that took us to the French Quarter and all over town. The breakfast was excellent an even included a chef to cook eggs any way you want them. The hotel was clean and the rooms were very nice. I would stay at this hotel again if I return to New Orleans. Parking was an issue. We were told that the hotel parking lot was full and they gave us directions to another lot to park. When we checked back with the desk after unloading our vehicle the manager was able to give us a parking space.
Reviews.Author: pdwhoney

Reviews.Content: nice hotel It was a pleasant experience and near the French Quarter. The beds were very comfortable. The staff and service were great.
Reviews.Author: trvlgal1966

Reviews.Content: Good Staff When They Knew We Existed My mother and I were in NOLA for a conference. The hotel is only two short blocks from the convention center, near a trolley that will take you to the French Quarter (for $1.25 exact change), and if you don't mind a little walk, the hotel isn't far from Canal Street. Overall our stay was comfortable. We decided on this hotel because, of the options we were given by the conference organizers, the Courtyard had the best parking rates and offered free Internet access. A softball team had rooms not far from ours and liked to sit outside their rooms and chat in the hallway, but the parents and chaperones must have terrific because by bedtime, the kids were quiet. We thought perhaps the hotel was having trouble maintaining an adequate staffing level, because housekeeping made no effort to refresh our room during our stay, though they very kindly complied when we asked for specific services -- such as fresh towels. I also could not access guest services on the television to check my daily charges. When I called about my inability to access guest services, I was told that the system was down temporarily -- but it was down all week. It turns out the housekeeping staff probably didn't even know we were there, and guest services wasn't available for us because we weren't officially guests of the hotel, according to the hotel's computers. The conference organizers mistakenly made three reservations for me, and in trying to eliminate the extra reservations, the desk manager ended up clearing all of my reservations. The mistake wasn't caught until I checked out. The manager who straightened it all out was terrific and I really appreciated her attitude. I wouldn't hesitate to stay there again -- but I'd make sure they knew I was there! ;}
Reviews.Author: makalu

Reviews.Content: The Big Easy Was in New Orleans for a convention. Hotel was very close to the convention centre and a safe walk. Nothing fancy. Make sure to get a room facing the courtyard as outer rooms, those facing street, apparently are noisy. Outdoor pool was dirty - not sure if it was cleaned all week. Buffet breakfast was OK. Would stay there again.
Reviews.Author: JoeyCatoria

Reviews.Content: comfy beds       lobby
Reviews.Author: lovestravel68

Reviews.Content: Our week in the big easy. We arrived to find that the hotel had accepted people from the street into the parking garage and had no empty spaces for our vehicle. Not only this, but their was no parking for a mile. We ended up parking and then walking back. We checked in amidst a chaotic scene, tons of party goers (this was 4 pm) were packed in the lobby leaving no room for us to even walk.Once we got to the room, we found it very small. The bathroom was so tiny you had to just about stand on the toilet to close the door. The beds were nice, and the rooms were clean.Although you would think that for the price they were charging breakfast would be included or discounted, there was no such luck. We ended up hiking across the street to the nearest MacDonalds.The room was noisy, but did have a good view. There was a steamboat that started up every morning, and at night it was as loud as a parade. This was every night though!I have to say, New Orleans could use some general maintenance work done. The hotel had small things that annoyed us like the elevator situation. You push a button and then wait for an elevator assignment. Sometimes your elevator came, sometimes you ended up walking down 15 flights of stairs. Thank goodness we weren't up any higher than that!
Reviews.Author: kdarocha

Reviews.Content: Be sure and ask for the quiet side of the hotel The Courtyard by Marriott Convention Center hotel on Julia Street in New Orleans has good rooms and a friendly staff but we couldn't sleep for the noise. Our room faced a street with a bar that played booming music and stayed open until 4 a.m. People were in the street, horns honking and police sirens occassionally. It was absolutely miserable.When I complained the staff went out of its way to try and make it up to us but we should have been told that the room was on the noisy side so we would have had options. If you book a room here, be sure and ask for the quiet side.
Reviews.Author: jlk0413

Reviews.Content: As expected in the Big Easy Overall, this is a nice property. Off the beaten path, but close enough to the French Quarter and Harrah's for a reasonable price. The rooms were Courtyard standard with good sized bathrooms. The lobby was very cool with an mod-warehouse look. One major grip is that the hotel is hard to find. You have to drive partial through a parking garage to get to the front door. I asked the Desk Clerk if they get a lot of phone calls from lost guests and he said they did. Not much they can do about it, but perhaps a large sign that says hotel entrance would be nice.
Reviews.Author: jhethcox

Reviews.Content: Comfortable, Clean and Quiet Just returned from New Orleans where I stayed at the Courtyard New Orleans Convention Center. The hotel was better than I expected. The room decor was art deco with an exposed brick wall, small television and large desk. The bed was a very comfortable foam mattress. The room was clean. I used the fitness center, nothing spectacular but adequate. Parking was convenient in the hotel's garage. Not much of a view in an area surrounded by what appear to be converted warehouses. Very convenient to the French Quarter, Convention Center, casino and Emeril's restaurant next door. Service was somewhat inconsistent. It is sort of no frills but the staff is polite. My only real complaint was I didn't get my wake up call, good thing I set my alarm.
Reviews.Author: peripeteia

Reviews.Content: Never Host a Meeting Here I helped host a meeting at this hotel and that experience was a total nightmare!! The rooms themselves were okay - very modern, art deco and the bed was very comfortable but the meeting rooms and the service at this hotel left much to be desired.Even though we had breakfast planned to be brought out by 7:45am right as our guests were arriving, it didn't come out until I hunted down the sales and catering manager and by the time he got his act together the meeting started without anyone having more than coffee. This happened all 3 days we were there despite me bringing copies of the banquet event orders that he'd signed. They also forgot to bring our afternoon refreshments out on the last 2 days and we still got charged for it.At one point the sales and catering manager hid from me because I came to ask him about our missing refreshments. Also, we had billing issues with this hotel until August 2007 (the meeting was held in April 2007).This is not a place to go if you're expecting excellent service. You're much better off staying at another hotel where the staff gives a damn about their guests.
Reviews.Author: Jaina2002

Reviews.Content: Very close to Canal Street This Courtyard by Marriott is just a block from Canal Street and the French Quarter. Since its on St. Charles Street, there is no self parking and valet parking is $23/night - which I though is a little high. The rooms are basic sized with all windows facing the interior area, so you don't have a view and the beds are comfortable. The A/C was a central air unit, and was extremely quiet. The rooms are quiet, and comfortable - a great place to stay while exploring the French Quarter. The cafe has your basic breakfast buffet. Overall, you will be happy with this hotel if you're just looking for a place to stay.
Reviews.Author: orbops

Reviews.Content: Perfectly fine little hotel You generally know what you're getting with the Courtyard by Marriott brand - a functional business hotel with clean, comfortable and no-frills rooms - and this hotel isn't much different. The rooms are exactly what you'd expect. What differentiates this hotel from other Courtyards I've stayed at is the clever look of the hotel's indoor public spaces and exterior. It looks like a converted warehouse, with weathered, exposed brick feel, and it works. Given that it's located in the Warehouse District, the hotel looks right at home. I took the advice of a previous reviewer and requested a room facing the pool (which, by the way, was also a nice little area), although there didn't seem to be any noise-related reasons not to request an outer-facing room. Other than a somewhat sleepy bar across the street, there isn't much to keep you awake at night.The area itself seems to be mostly for hotels and some good restaurants - and it's a nice departure from the hustle and bustle of the French Quarter roughly a mile away. If I visit New Orleans again, I'm likely to stay in this area, and would consider returning to the Courtyard.
Reviews.Author: wise2374

Reviews.Content: Ask that your room not face S. Peters St, loud bar 10pm-1am The 鈥淗owling Wolf鈥?bar will greet you from 10pm - 1am if you are placed in the rooms on the South side facing S Peters St. The music was so loud that you could see the windows in the room moving. It might have been OK if the music was jazz or blues, but it was what my wife calls 鈥淒evil Music鈥? That really hard, screaming, loud noise some call music. I called down for a new room and was told there were none and the music should stop around 1am. Since I was in bed at 9:30 that was not welcome news. I even tried sleeping in the bathroom but it was still too loud. The mattress is just 4 inches of foam on bed springs. Not very comfortable.It is close to the Convention Center (2 blocks) and the River Walk Mall. If you stay, ask that your room not face S. Peters St.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Ok stay I stayed here while attending a convention. The beds were too firm for me. The staff at the front desk were ok but not very friendly. The could have been more professional, but no one was ever rude to me.For the price you pay you might as well get the Breakfast Lovers package which includes the cost of breakfast during your stay. If Bourbon Street is what you want then you should not stay here unless you do not mind walking there. This location is near the Convention Center. It was pretty quiet when I was there, however it can be noisy if there are alot of people.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Pleasantly Surprised Stayed here for my 1 year anniversary - wasn't too impressed by the picture shown here - but when you get there it's a very cute little place. In the Warehouse district and our room had a brick wall and wood ceilings - very cool. We enjoyed very much - had the jacuzzi suite. Great location - walked to everywhere we wanted to go. It's a little hike to the Quarter - but we hit a lot of the local places around and really liked the location and hotel. Staff was very friendly. Definitely nicer and cleaner than some places I have stayed on the Superdome side of town!
Reviews.Author: msucheer

Reviews.Content: Will never stay there again A nightmare!They have a sticker on the doors: Free wireless WiFi Internet connection.Funny, nobody had any idea about that.(and I booked the hotel for that reason)I reserved a smoking room, mine was No smoking.I reserved a King bed, there was 2 queen beds in the room.The room was noisy.(water from condensation? falling from the roof and bouncing in the window of the corridor!)The guests in the next rooms noisy, playing and screaming in their rooms till 2 AM...security...Hello?
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Loud, noisy, not for families We stayed here in March 04 for a cheerleading comp. at the Convention Center. It was still several miles of walking to get to the opposite end of the convention center. We took a taxi back (for $10!) New Orleans is not a convenient travel town anyway (one-way streets, very little and expensive parking), but this was hotel was only convenient to the RiverWalk mall and trolley system. It is five stories tall. We were on the top floor, but the alley outside was loud all night long-beer bottles breaking, car horns, music, talking! The beds are not real comfortable. The pool area is nice and things are fairly clean. $200 a night seemed expensive for what we received. They did not offer shuttles anywhere and the staff at the desk was rude. This place is hard to find, too. I have stayed at the Marriott closer to Bourbon Street. It is much better and closer to attractions.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Great Location for Mardi Gras The Courtyard by Marriott New Orleans Downtown near the French Quarter 124 St. Charles Ave., is an excellent location to enjoy Mardi Gras! Get a room facing St. Charles Ave. and enjoy all the uptown parades right from your room windows. Or, step right outside the front door of the hotel for maximum viweing and bead-catching. The location is excellent - only 2 blocks from the French Quarter and the St. Charles streetcar stops right outside the hotel. Beware during Mardi Gras that the street cars will stop running around 5 pm on St. Charles to prepare for the parade route - we got stranded uptown and had to walk quite a ways before we were able to flag down a cab. Hotel is clean, comfortable, staff is pleasant and several good restaurants are steps away. We enjoyed our stay there very much and will definitely return!
Reviews.Author: coastho
